subject: international quikscript
msgSnippet: I will soon start my project of common words spelt according to the following International QuikScript proposal based on John s proposal in message #2017 : #
messageBody:
I will soon start my project of common words spelt according to the
following International QuikScript proposal based on John's proposal
in message #2017 :

# the spelling of vowels will be based on Well's lexical sets -
- The 15 non-rhotic stressed vowels:
KIT = 26 It
FLEECE = 27 Eat
DRESS = 28 Et
FACE = 29 Eight
TRAP = 30 At
PRICE = 31 I
PALM = 32 Ah
THOUGHT = 33 Awe
LOT = 34 Ox
CHOICE = 35 Oy
STRUT = 36 Utter
MOUTH = 37 Out
GOAT = 38 Owe
FOOT = 39 Foot
GOOSE = 40 Ooze
BATH = 30 At
CLOTH = 34 Ox
- The 7 sets of rhotic stressed vowels:
NURSE = 36 Utter + 25 Roe
START = 32 Ah + 25 Roe
SQUARE = 29 Eight + 25 Roe
NEAR = 27 Eat + 25 Roe
CURE = 40 Ooze + 25 Roe
FORCE = 33 Awe + 25 Roe
NORTH = 33 Awe + 25 Roe
- The four unstressed sets:
happY = 27 Eat : contrary to the manual
commA = 36 Utter
lettER = 36 Utter + 25 Roe
intO = 40 Ooze

# if a conflict among pronunciation between accents that isn't
resolved by the above arises then RP+rhoticism will take precedence

At this stage I'm thinking of creating a spreadsheet with columns:
Word : POS : RP-Ph : RP-QS : GA-Ph : GA-QS : GAu-Ph : GAu-QS :
main.Int.QS : alt.Int.QS
where
- Word : is the word being spelt
- POS : is the part-of-speech
- RP, GA, GAu are the Received Pronunication, General American and the
General Australian accents respectively
- x-Ph : means phonetic spelling using XSampa according to the accent
of x - all alternatives of the accent from most common to least listed
- x-QS, GA-QS, GAu-QS : is the quikscript spelling according to the
accent of x - all alternatives of the accent from most common to least
listed
-main.Int.QS : is the international quikscript spelling according to
this proposal - the main spelling will be spelling of the most common
alternative spelt according to this proposal. eg: _again_ would be
spelt 'utter+gay+et+no' and not 'utter+gay+eight+no' because the first
is more common.
- alt.int.QS : is the international quikscript spelling of the other
alternatives according to this proposal

I would like to know what other people think about using 'Eat' instead
of 'It' for the happY set.

I would also like to know what people think about the distinction
between 'Way' (18) and 'Why' (20) - should they be merged, optional
distinction or kept distinct?
